bug.author: myungjoo
bug.summary: [Bug in Build Infra] Dep-package 'tensorflow' in tizen.org
bug.description:
In the build code for Debian/Ubuntu, tensorflow has incorrect code that breaks aarch64/armv7 build in launchpad: <denchmark-link:https://git.tizen.org/cgit/platform/upstream/tensorflow/tree/debian/control?h=tizen>https://git.tizen.org/cgit/platform/upstream/tensorflow/tree/debian/control?h=tizen</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>Build-Depends: debhelper (>=9), sed, zlib1g-dev, cmake (>=3.9), python, git, python-numpy, swig, python-dev, libc6-dev, libc6-dev-i386, unzip </denchmark-code>
Please remove i386 or use architecture-macro. Related launchpad build log: <denchmark-link:https://launchpadlibrarian.net/392924175/buildlog_ubuntu-bionic-arm64.tensorflow_1.9.0-0~201810080620~ubuntu18.04.1_BUILDING.txt.gz>https://launchpadlibrarian.net/392924175/buildlog_ubuntu-bionic-arm64.tensorflow_1.9.0-0~201810080620~ubuntu18.04.1_BUILDING.txt.gz</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>The following packages have unmet dependencies: sbuild-build-depends-tensorflow-dummy : Depends: cmake (>= 3.9) but it is not going to be installed Depends: libc6-dev-i386 but it is not installable </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: : Thank you for posting issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/issues/645>#645</denchmark-link> . The person in charge will reply soon.

After removing libc6-dev-i386 in Build-Depends, tensorflow-aarch64 completed to be built on launchpad.net. However, armhf version failed to be built because of another issue. So I am going to close this and create new one.
